title: Epic: Execution Isolation & Parallelization (RalphBlaster-inspired)
description:
## Overview
Implement git worktree-based task isolation enabling true parallel execution, confidence-based auto-merge, and external notifications. Inspired by RalphBlaster demo (@saasmakermac).

## Business Value
- **Parallel execution**: 3 tickets â†’ 3 PRs in ~11 minutes
- **Isolation**: Each task in clean worktree, no conflicts
- **Autonomy dial**: Configurable auto-merge based on confidence
- **UX**: Human becomes ticket creator only - 'sip coffee' workflow

## Key Features
1. Git worktree isolation per task
2. Parallel batch processing (multiple worktrees)
3. Confidence-based auto-merge
4. Worktree cleanup automation
5. External notifications (Slack/Discord/Telegram)

## Technical Context
```bash
# Per-task isolation
git worktree add ../ralph-<task-name> <branch>
cd ../ralph-<task-name>
./ralph start

# After merge
git worktree remove ../ralph-<task-name>
```

## Dependencies
- Epic 01: Core Loop (task execution)
- Epic 04: Tool Integration (git operations)

## Source
- RalphBlaster demo: @saasmakermac
- Original Ralph Wiggum: @ghuntley
- Ryan Carson workflow: @ryancarson

title: RALPH should use feature branches and PRs, not push to main
description:
## Problem
RALPH-AGI currently has GitTools (status, add, commit, log, diff) but nothing enforces proper git workflow. An autonomous agent pushing directly to main is dangerous.

## Requirements
1. RALPH should create feature branches before making changes
2. RALPH should push branches and create PRs (not push to main)
3. RALPH should wait for CI/approval before merging (or flag for human review)
4. Config option to control strictness (solo dev vs team workflow)

## Implementation Ideas
- Add `git_workflow` config: `direct` | `branch` | `pr`
- Add GitTools: `create_branch()`, `push_branch()`, `create_pr()`
- Builder prompt should instruct proper workflow
- Verification layer should reject direct-to-main commits

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] RALPH creates feature branch before code changes
- [ ] RALPH pushes branch and creates PR
- [ ] RALPH never pushes directly to protected branches
- [ ] Configurable workflow modes
